alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued June 14 at 2:34AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT WEDNESDAY FOR ELEVATIONS ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow for elevations above 5000 feet. Additional snow accumulations of up to 10 inches from 5000 feet to 6000 feet, between 10 and 20 inches from 6000 feet to 7000 feet, and up to 30 inches above 7000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...Until 6 AM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult over Marias Pass and other routes within or adjacent to Glacier National Park. Dangerous backcountry conditions will exist, especially for those recreating in the high country of Glacier National Park due to reduced visibilities and the cold and wet conditions. High snowfall rates in the high country will quickly lead to snow covered routes, and could lead to disorientation. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to snow-loaded trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The National Weather Service recommends that those who are recreating in the back country, especially those who are not prepared for winter conditions, should move to lower elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or visiting the MDT Road Report website.
